content:
Key Findings

  • The total spend analysed by AI DOGE is £332.9M across 43,063 transactions.
  • The data coverage spans 10 financial years, from 2016/17 to 2025/26.
  • The data source is West Lancashire Borough Council's published spending records, which are made available under the Local Government Transparency Code.
  • The number of transactions is 43,063, indicating a significant amount of financial activity within the council.
  • The council's spending data is subject to analysis and scrutiny, with AI DOGE's automated analysis flagging no issues in several key areas.

Introduction to West Lancashire Borough Council's Spending

West Lancashire Borough Council, a district council in Lancashire, England, has published its spending records in accordance with the Local Government Transparency Code. The data, which covers 10 financial years from 2016/17 to 2025/26, provides a comprehensive overview of the council's financial activities. With a total spend of £332.9M across 43,063 transactions, the data offers valuable insights into the council's expenditure patterns.

The data coverage of 10 financial years allows for a detailed analysis of the council's spending trends and patterns. The fact that the data source is the council's published spending records ensures that the information is accurate and reliable. Furthermore, the absence of any issues flagged by AI DOGE's automated analysis suggests that the council's financial management practices are sound.

The analysis of the council's spending data is crucial in ensuring transparency and accountability in public spending. By examining the data, citizens can gain a better understanding of how their tax money is being utilised. The data can also help identify areas where the council can improve its financial management and make more efficient use of resources.

Analysis of Spending Patterns

The spending data reveals that the council has engaged in a significant amount of financial activity, with 43,063 transactions recorded over the 10-year period. This suggests that the council has been actively managing its finances and making efforts to utilise its resources effectively. The total spend of £332.9M is a substantial amount, and it is essential to examine how this money has been allocated across different areas.

Although the data does not provide information on specific suppliers, it is clear that the council has been working with various organisations to deliver its services. The fact that AI DOGE's automated analysis flagged no issues in several key areas, including duplicates, split payments, round-number anomalies, and Benford's Law results, suggests that the council's financial management practices are robust.

The analysis of the spending data can be further enhanced by examining the council's budget allocations and financial reports. This can provide a more detailed understanding of the council's spending patterns and help identify areas where improvements can be made. By scrutinising the data and seeking transparency, citizens can play an active role in ensuring that the council's finances are managed effectively.

Conclusion and Next Steps

In conclusion, the analysis of West Lancashire Borough Council's spending data provides valuable insights into the council's financial activities. The data, which spans 10 financial years, reveals a total spend of £332.9M across 43,063 transactions. The absence of any issues flagged by AI DOGE's automated analysis suggests that the council's financial management practices are sound.

However, it is essential to continue monitoring the council's spending patterns and financial management practices to ensure transparency and accountability. Citizens can play an active role in this process by examining the data, attending council committee meetings, and engaging with their local councillors.

By working together, citizens and the council can ensure that public funds are utilised effectively and efficiently. The analysis of the spending data is an essential step in this process, and AI DOGE's automated analysis provides a valuable tool for scrutinising the data and identifying areas for improvement.

What You Can Do

  • Submit a Freedom of Information request to West Lancashire Borough Council about their spending patterns and financial management practices.
  • Attend council committee meetings, which are open to the public, to gain a better understanding of the council's decision-making processes.
  • Check the council's published contracts register to examine the details of their contracts with suppliers.
  • Write to your local councillor about your concerns regarding the council's spending patterns and financial management practices.
  • Visit aidoge.co.uk to explore the full spending data and gain a deeper understanding of the council's financial activities.
This article is based on West Lancashire Borough Council's published spending data covering 2016/17 to 2025/26. All figures are drawn directly from transactions published under the Local Government Transparency Code. Analysis by AI DOGE.
